analysis.heading: Primary daylight plane (sides)
analysis.content: The primary daylight plane regulates structures located within the buildable area. Structures located in the rear and/or side yards are regulated by the accessory-structure daylight plan described on the next page. The daylight plane in conjunction with the setbacks & height limits, create an invisible tent intended to contain development on the lot in a way that preserves privacy and exposure to natural light.
figures: Fig 20 Front elevation showing side primary daylight plane - Diagram showing a house elevation with daylight plane angles and measurements including 45° angle, 24' height limit, and 10' setback
